Third-Party Licensesïƒ

DDF uses several open-source libraries, each with their own licenses:

Core Dependenciesïƒ

  • PyYAML - MIT License

  • Rich - MIT License

  • richcolorlog - MIT License

  • pydebugger - MIT License

  • configset - MIT License

  • rich-argparse - MIT License

  • clipboard - MIT License

Optional Dependenciesïƒ

  • redis - BSD 3-Clause License

  • pymemcache - Apache License 2.0

  • pystray - GPL v3

  • Pillow - HPND License

  • plyer - MIT License

  • watchdog - Apache License 2.0

Development Dependenciesïƒ

  • pytest - MIT License

  • black - MIT License

  • flake8 - MIT License

  • mypy - MIT License

  • sphinx - BSD License

For Commercial Useïƒ

DDF can be used in commercial projects without any restrictions. You are free to:

  • Use DDF in commercial applications

  • Modify DDF for commercial purposes

  • Distribute modified versions commercially

  • Include DDF in proprietary software

The only requirement is including the MIT license and copyright notice.

Contributionsïƒ

By contributing to DDF, you agree that your contributions will be licensed under the same MIT License.

Attributionïƒ

While not required by the license, attribution is appreciated:

This project uses DDF (https://github.com/cumulus13/ddf)
Copyright (c) 2025 Hadi Cahyadi

Or in documentation:
